data.sampled:
The tenth day of September in the year two-thousand-twenty was a Thursday. period.
2020-09-10 was a Thursday, and was written in sentance form it would look like this;

The tenth day of September in the year two-thousand-twenty was a Thursday. 

Here is a visual example for you:
![Thursday 9/10/21](https://www.wolframalpha.com/input?i=September+10+2020+was+a+Thursday.)
September 10th, 2020 on a Thursday.

![September 10th, 2020 on a Thursday. ](https://www.wolframalpha.com/input?i=September+10+2020+was+a+Thursday.)
Please let me know if you have any other questions.
In the USA it is now Saturday, 2023, April 9th, 2023 at 14:40  (UTC-4 EST)
It is now in the year 2023, or 2 thousand 2 hundred and 3 AD. 2023 in the 21 century, and 23 in the 20th century.  
It was a saturday on April 9th 2023, and 4:40 PM in the eastern time zone, or the UTC-4 EST timezone. The UTC-4 is a common timezone used in the USA.

The date April 9th

data.sampled:
Sure, here is the converted sentence:

"December 28, 1932."

You can use Python to format to date like this:

date = '1932-12-28'
month_name = ['January','February','March','April','May','June','July','August','September','October','November','December'][int(date[4:])-1]
sentence = '{weekday}, {month} {day}, {year}.'.format(weekday=date[0:3],month=month_name,day=date[5:7],year=date[8:10])
print(sentence) # Output: "Tuesday, December 28, 1932."
